subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0100_01C9F4A8.11315AA0

It goes without saying that if everything is as he says, then it is pretty =
good evidence.

Paranormal means beyond normal. It means it can't be explai=
n by normal means.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: threadsintyme@j=
uno.com 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, June 24, 2009 8:=
38 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over=
 another






  Sounds like you are jumping the gun a bit, April...all we =
know is what Zack has told us. :) Zack, I am not saying that you are being =
untruthful in any respect. What if Zack is incorrect?

  So, given your poi=
nt that he has indeed captured something "paranormal" in nature...just what=
 does that mean? How do we interpret that "evidence"? 
  Al
  ---------- Or=
iginal Message ----------
  From: "April Abercrombie" <april@abercrombiegho=
stresearch.com>
  To: <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Wh=
y does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another
  Date: Wed, 24 Jun 2009=
 08:17:46 -0600




  Evidence that his EVP was a True EVP. Evidence that h=
e indeed captured something paranormal in nature.

    ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
    From: threadsintyme@... 
    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
 
    Sent: Wednesday, June 24, 2009 8:13 AM
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why=
 does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another


    Evidence of what? 
=
    Al
    ---------- Original Message ----------
    From: "April Abercrom=
bie" <april@...>
    To: <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>=

    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over an=
other
    Date: Wed, 24 Jun 2009 07:50:03 -0600




    I would call that p=
retty good evidence right there.

      ----- Original Message ----- 
     =
 From: Zack Widup 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Wednesday=
, June 24, 2009 7:46 AM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital rec=
order capture EVP over another



      Interesting topic!

      BTW that =
investigation was at the former Manteno State Mental Hospital. It included =
the amazing "It's Harold Wing" EVP I got. None of the people doing the inve=
stigation there had ever heard of Harold Wing. Upon later examination of ol=
d records, it was found that Harold Wing was actually a patient who died th=
ere of typhoid fever in 1938. But we didn't find that out until weeks later=
.

      How do you explain that conventionally?
      :-)

      Zack

   =
    
      On Wed, Jun 24, 2009 at 8:36 AM, April Abercrombie <april@abercr=
ombieghostresearch.com> wrote:





        A similar thing happened to me =
on our last investigation too.

          ----- Original Message ----- 
   =
       From: Zack Widup 
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
          S=
ent: Wednesday, June 24, 2009 7:19 AM
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why =
does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another



          There's anoth=
er possibility: possibly the spirits involved only wish to impart sounds to=
 a particular unit or units.

          I was surprised on one investigatio=
n I was on to get mostly all the same EVP on my DVR, which was hanging from=
 my belt, and my camcorder, which was in front of my face. Other people on =
the investigation didn't get them at all. Go figure! 
          :-)

      =
    Zack


          On Tue, Jun 23, 2009 at 3:26 PM, Rj <rasterer@...=
m> wrote:




                  There could be several reasons, and it's on=
ly conjecture without comparing the two specific units in questions.  But s=
ome ideas:

                  1) The battery level on one is different than=
 the other, and causing one to function less optimally and introduce noise =
or artifacts into the stream.
                  2) They were not actually '=
sitting' side by side, but being swung around.
                  3) They ar=
e pointed at different areas
                  4) One may be older than the=
 other or have been dropped a few times.
                  5) One may have =
been recently exposed to extreme humidity or temperatures, while the other =
remained in a comfortable environment, before doing this recording
        =
          6) One may be sitting in a position more subject by airflow or vi=
brations
                  7) They may use different memory cards. that hav=
e different error or accuracy profiles
                  8) The final sound=
 files may have been processed differently in various software programs
   =
               9) People in the room may be nearer and moving closer to one=
 than the other
                  10) They may simply be two different mode=
ls with different recording sensitives and limitations



                 =
 --- On Tue, 6/23/09, lechevar2000 <lechevar@...> wrote:


        =
            From: lechevar2000 <lechevar@...>
                    S=
ubject: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another
    =
                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
                    Date: Tuesd=
ay, June 23, 2009, 5:57 AM 



                    Hi, 
                   =
 I believe I saw an explaination on this list about why if you have 2 recor=
ders sitting side by side, why may one capture an EVP on one and not the ot=
her? Someone was explaining about an energy field like a bubble. 
         =
           I'm trying to explain this theory to a friend. Can someone help =
me? 
                    Thanks Laura
